Assignment Project Experience * List experiences of projects performed alone or in a team in reverse chronological order
Development of a service for analyzing and comparing cosmetic ingredients using OCR technology and recommending AI cosmetics
Project Period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20
Personnel Composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself)
Project Objective Extract text from photos of cosmetic ingredients and recommend cosmetics to users
Main Tasks and Detailed Roles
Development of Korean-based OCR model
Development of algorithm for calculating scores based on ingredients
Cosmetic recommendation using Cosine similarity
Languages and Development Environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server used (Linux)
Impressions
I realized the importance of data while developing AI models. I used the Korean medicine and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub as a reference, as the Naver Clovaai I used was an English-based model.

I proceeded.
There was an excessive amount of text in the photos of cosmetic ingredients, so I trained them by cutting them to less than 30 characters. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, there was difficulty in extracting the desired level of complete text in the Backend.
To overcome this, I introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by Fine-tuning the cosmetic ingredients with GPT Assistant.
Reference https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/tree/master
Developer hiring platform
answer: I mainly use Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and for web development, I use Node.js and Flask. I also use Git, Docker, AWS, Linux, and RESTful API for other technologies.

question: What is the experience of a failed project and the lessons learned from it?
context: Experience of project assignments, performing projects alone or in teams in reverse chronological order

The experience of the failed project seems to have been encountering difficulties in extracting complete text at the desired level from cosmetics ingredient photos due to limitations in data and computing resources on the Backend. question: What is the reason for choosing the applied position?
context: Experience in project projects * Experience in performing projects alone or in team formation in reverse chronological order OCR technology-based cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Manpower composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself) Project purpose Extract text from cosmetic ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Korean-based OCR model development Development of score calculation algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Language and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server use (Linux) Impressions Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. Naver Clovaai, which was used as a reference material, is an English-based model, so I learned using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub. --- Proceeded. answer: The applicant has experience in performing projects as an AI engineer using OCR technology to analyze cosmetics ingredients and develop an AI cosmetics recommendation service. question: What did you learn from your personal project?
context: Experience of project assignments * Experience of performing projects alone or in team composition in reverse chronological order OCR technology-based cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Personnel composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1(myself) Project purpose Extracting text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommending cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Korean-based OCR model development Development of score calculation algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Languages and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server use (Linux) Points felt Realized the importance of data while developing an AI model. answer: In my personal project, I realized the importance of data. Particularly, while developing a Korean-based OCR model, I faced difficulties in extracting complete text from cosmetics ingredient photos. To overcome this, I introduced a method of fine-tuning cosmetics ingredients with GPT Assistant to refine the text extracted by the OCR model.

I proceeded.
Due to excessive text in the cosmetics ingredient photos, I trained the model by cutting it to less than 30 characters. However, due to the limitations of data and computing resources, there was difficulty in extracting the desired level of complete text in the Backend. To overcome this, I introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by fine-tuning the cosmetics ingredients with GPT Assistant. Project Objective: Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users
Main Tasks and Detailed Roles:
- Development of Korean-based OCR model
- Development of algorithm for calculating scores based on ingredients

GitHub Repositories or Code Samples: - Provide links to your GitHub repositories or code snippets related to the computer vision and image processing projects. - Showcase your ability to write clean and efficient code. By incorporating these elements in your portfolio, you can effectively showcase your expertise in computer vision and image processing to potential employers or collaborators.

question: If you have experienced any difficulties while creating your portfolio, please share.
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An
answer: I faced difficulties while working on a project analyzing cosmetics ingredients using OCR technology for my portfolio. The cosmetics ingredient photos had excessive text, so I had to cut them to 30 characters or less for training. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, I had difficulty extracting the desired level of complete text from the backend. To overcome this, I fine-tuned the cosmetics ingredients with GPT Assistant to introduce a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model.

question: What information should be added to a resume to enhance a developer portfolio?
context: I have worked on...
answer:
The resume already includes a variety of technical skills. However, to further enhance the developer portfolio, the following information can be added:

1. Specific project experiences: Include information about specific projects using the mentioned technical skills. It is important to detail your role, problems solved, and outcomes achieved in each project.

2. Personal projects: Experience from personal projects or contributions to open-source projects is valuable.

3. Internship or job-related experiences: Include experiences related to job duties as a developer, internship experiences, etc.

4. Education and certifications: Adding information about relevant degrees or certifications in the field is beneficial.

5. Link to a tech blog: Sharing tech blogs or presentation materials authored by you can showcase your expertise.

6. Teamwork or leadership experiences: Soft skills like teamwork and leadership are important. Sharing experiences from team projects or roles as a leader can be beneficial.

question: How can I showcase my skill set more effectively in my portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An
answer:
To showcase your skill set more effectively in your portfolio, you can consider the following strategies:

1. **Highlight Key Skills:** Create a distinct section in your portfolio specifically dedicated to your skill set. List out your technical skills, programming languages, tools, and technologies you are proficient in.

2. **Provide Examples:** For each skill mentioned, provide specific examples or projects where you have applied that skill successfully. This helps demonstrate your practical experience and expertise.

3. **Use Visuals:** Incorporate visual elements such as graphs, charts, or infographics to visually represent your skill set. This can help make your skills stand out and easily understandable.

4. **Include Certifications:** If you hold any relevant certifications or have completed courses in specific skills, make sure to include them in your portfolio. This adds credibility to your skill set.

5. **Showcase Projects:** Feature a few key projects that highlight the diverse range of skills you possess. Describe your role, the technologies used, and the impact of the project in showcasing your skills.

6. **Testimonials or Recommendations:** If possible, include testimonials from peers, clients, or supervisors that speak to your skills and expertise in a particular area.

By incorporating these strategies, you can effectively showcase your skill set in your portfolio and make a strong impression on potential employers or collaborators.

question: Are there any tips for creating a good GitHub profile for a developer portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼m ChangHoon An...
answer:
Here are some tips to enhance your GitHub profile:
1. Set display name: You can set your display name on GitHub profile as your name or username. Using your name can make it easier for others to identify you.
2. Upload profile picture: Uploading a profile picture on GitHub can make your profile more personal. Typically, people use a face photo or a logo.
3. Add bio to profile: Adding a brief introduction of your skills, project experience, etc., in the bio section of your GitHub profile can help others understand you better.
4. Publicize and update projects: Make your projects public on GitHub and update them regularly to allow others to evaluate your skills.
5. Write README file: Detail project introduction, usage, technology stack, etc., in the README file of your GitHub project to help others understand the project.
By following these tips, your GitHub profile can appear more professional and appealing.

question: Please tell us about the difficulties and resolution process encountered during the project.
context: Experience of project assignments * List experiences of performing projects alone or in a team in reverse chronological order OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Manpower composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself) Project objective Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Korean-based OCR model development Developing score calculation algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Languages and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server usage (Linux) Reflections Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. Used Naver Clovaai as a reference, which is an English-based model, and trained using AI Hub's Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset. Proceeded with the training by cutting the text in cosmetics ingredient photos to 30 characters or less due to excessive text. However, there were difficulties in extracting complete text at the desired level in the Backend due to limitations in data and computing resources. To overcome this, we introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by fine-tuning cosmetics ingredients with GPT Assistant. Reference material https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/tree/master Developer hiring platform Community Detection in Various Network Datasets Using Genetic Algorithms Detected community structure using genetic algorithms Combining Global optimization search method Genetic Algorithm (GA) and Local optimization algorithm Louvain https://github.com/gnssl98/GeneticAlgorithm Field Task R&D Undergraduate Intern Researching split sequence technique for time series data Attempting performance improvement through hyperparameter adjustment and loss function modification Cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development using OCR technology (https://github.com/gnssl98/graduation_project) Korean-based OCR model development
answer: During the project, there was a problem of extracting excessive text from cosmetics ingredient photos. To address this, we cut the text to 30 characters or less for training. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, there were difficulties in extracting complete text at the desired level. To overcome this issue, we introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by fine-tuning cosmetics ingredients with GPT Assistant.

question: If there are key points to be aware of when creating a portfolio, what are they?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An ...
answer:
When creating a portfolio, it is important to pay attention to several key points:

1. **Clarity and Organization:** Ensure that your portfolio is well-organized and easy to navigate. Clearly label each project or section to make it easy for viewers to find information.

2. **Relevance:** Include projects or work samples that are relevant to the position or field you are targeting. Tailor your portfolio to showcase your skills and experiences that align with the requirements of the job you are applying for.

3. **Visual Appeal:** Make sure your portfolio has a professional and visually appealing design. Use consistent formatting, appropriate fonts, and colors to enhance the overall presentation.

4. **Conciseness:** Present your projects or work experiences concisely, highlighting key achievements and outcomes. Avoid including unnecessary details that may overwhelm or confuse the reader.

5. **Accuracy and Proofreading:** Double-check all the information in your portfolio for accuracy. Typos or errors can detract from the professionalism of your work. Proofread your content carefully before finalizing your portfolio.

6. **Include Contact Information:** Make sure to include your contact information, such as your email address or LinkedIn profile, so that potential employers can easily reach out to you for further discussions or opportunities.

By keeping these points in mind, you can create a strong and impactful portfolio that effectively showcases your skills and experiences to potential employers or clients.

question: Are there any important points to keep in mind when creating a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An 5 --- Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) LoRA-based Fine-Tuning on Prompt-driven Translation Tasks (koâ†’en, enâ†’ko) Vector DB Extract Context Translation Model(ko-en) QA Model(English) Translation Model(en-ko) Output Model Structure Translation Model : facebook/mbart-large-50-one-to-many-mmt QA Model : google/flan-t5-large https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot Portfolio ChatBot Using GPT API(~ing) Use RAG, GPT API (âœ…) , AWS(~ing) Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An 4 --- Purpose: Job application Submission Source: Gachon University Issuance Date: 2025/01/09 Validity Period: 2025/04/09 (INTERNET NO) 3435814227233992 This certificate is issued as an electronic certificate (PDF file). When printed, the output is recognized as a copy. If the electronic certificate verification viewer is not available, the originality and electronic signature cannot be verified, and the originality is not indicated. The electronic certificate verification viewer can be downloaded from https://www.certpia.com/eDown.
answer: When creating a portfolio, there are several important points to keep in mind: 1. Relevancy: Ensure that the projects and experiences highlighted in your portfolio are relevant to the position you are applying for. Tailoring your portfolio to showcase skills and accomplishments that align with the job requirements can make a strong impression. 2. Organization: Structure your portfolio in a clear and easy-to-navigate format. Use sections or categories to group similar projects together and include a table of contents if necessary. 3. Visual Appeal: Utilize a clean and professional design for your portfolio. Incorporate visual elements such as images, graphs, or infographics to make it visually engaging. 4. Description: Provide clear and concise descriptions of each project or experience included in your portfolio. Highlight your role, the problem you solved, and the results achieved. 5. Update Regularly: Keep your portfolio up to date with your latest projects, skills, and achievements. Regularly review and edit your portfolio to ensure that it reflects your current abilities and accomplishments. By paying attention to these aspects, you can create a compelling portfolio that effectively showcases your skills and experiences to potential employers.

question: When constructing a portfolio, are there any points to be careful about?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An 5 --- ...
answer: When constructing a portfolio, it is important to make sure that it is well-organized, visually appealing, and easy to navigate. Here are some key points to consider when putting together a portfolio: 1. Content Relevance: Include projects and experiences that are relevant to the field you are applying for. Tailor your portfolio to highlight your skills and accomplishments that align with the job or industry you are targeting. 2. Clear Project Descriptions: Clearly describe each project, outlining the problem you solved, your role, the technologies used, and the impact of the project. Providing specific details will help showcase your abilities and accomplishments. 3. Visual Appeal: Use a clean and professional design for your portfolio. Visual elements such as color schemes, fonts, and layout should be consistent and visually appealing. Including images, graphs, or charts to showcase your work can also enhance the overall look of your portfolio. 4. Navigation: Ensure that your portfolio is easy to navigate. Use clear headings, sections, and navigation menus to help users find the information they are looking for quickly and easily. 5. Contact Information: Include your contact information such as email address, phone number, and LinkedIn profile link so that potential employers or collaborators can easily reach out to you. 6. Update Regularly: Keep your portfolio up to date with your latest projects, achievements, and experiences. Regularly updating your portfolio will ensure that it reflects your current skills and capabilities. By following these guidelines, you can create a strong and effective portfolio that effectively showcases your skills and experiences to potential employers or collaborators.

answer: When creating a portfolio, here are some helpful tips: 1. Project List: Include a variety of projects in your portfolio. question: Please tell me how to effectively structure a portfolio.
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) at https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt
answer:
To effectively structure a portfolio, it's important to consider the following key aspects:

1. **Clear and Concise Introduction**: Start your portfolio with a brief introduction that highlights your name, expertise, and perhaps a tagline summarizing your skills or focus areas.

2. **Projects Showcase**: Display your projects clearly, including project titles, descriptions, technologies used, and outcomes. Highlighting the impact or results of each project can help demonstrate your skills effectively.

3. **Visual Appeal**: Use a clean and visually appealing design to make your portfolio visually engaging. Incorporate images, diagrams, or charts where relevant to showcase your work.

4. **Organization**: Arrange your projects in a logical order, such as by date, relevance, or category. This makes it easier for viewers to navigate through your portfolio and understand your progression.

5. **Skills and Technologies**: Clearly list your skills, tools, and technologies you are proficient in. This section can help recruiters or clients understand your expertise at a glance.

6. **Testimonials or Recommendations**: If possible, include testimonials or recommendations from colleagues, clients, or supervisors to add credibility to your work.

7. **Contact Information**: Ensure that your contact information is easily accessible in your portfolio, making it simple for potential collaborators or employers to reach out to you.

By following these guidelines and ensuring your portfolio is well-organized, visually appealing, and effectively showcases your skills and projects, you can create a strong and impactful portfolio to impress potential employers or clients.

question: What is the most important factor to consider when composing a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer: The most important factor to consider when composing a portfolio is the content and results of the projects. Efforts should be made to clearly express the project's purpose, the technologies used, the effectiveness of the results, and its contributions. Additionally, the projects listed in the portfolio should cover a wide range of topics and technologies, and be structured in a way that is easy for users to understand. When these elements are evaluated comprehensively, the effectiveness of the portfolio can be maximized.

question: What should I be careful about when creating a portfolio?

answer: When creating a portfolio, here are some points to be careful about: 1. The content of the portfolio should be clearly structured. It should include detailed project information, technology stack, models, and frameworks used. 2. The project descriptions should be concise and easy to understand. If using technical terms or abbreviations, explanations should be provided to ensure understanding even for those unfamiliar with the abbreviations. 3. The results and achievements of the projects included in the portfolio should be clearly described. It should be clear what problems were solved and what contributions were made. 4. If the project includes code or links, a way to easily access them should be provided. Including GitHub links or project execution methods is recommended. 5. The portfolio should always be kept up to date. When there are new projects or updated information, it should be added to update the portfolio.

question: When updating your portfolio, are there any key points to pay attention to?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer:
When updating your portfolio, it is essential to pay attention to a few key points to ensure it effectively showcases your skills and achievements:

1. **Relevance**: Make sure to include only relevant projects and experiences that highlight your strengths and expertise in the field you are targeting. Tailor the content to the specific roles or industries you are interested in.

2. **Accuracy**: Double-check all information in your portfolio, including project descriptions, technologies used, and any accomplishments. Ensure that there are no typos or errors that could detract from the professionalism of your portfolio.

3. **Visibility**: Organize your portfolio in a clear and visually appealing manner. Use appropriate formatting, headings, and sections to make it easy for recruiters or potential clients to navigate and understand your work.

4. **Consistency**: Maintain a consistent style throughout your portfolio, including font choices, color scheme, and formatting. This consistency helps create a cohesive and polished look that reflects your attention to detail.

5. **Update Regularly**: Keep your portfolio up to date with your latest projects, skills, and achievements. Regular updates show that you are actively involved in your field and continuously improving your expertise.

By following these guidelines, you can ensure that your portfolio effectively showcases your abilities and makes a strong impression on those reviewing it.

I encountered challenges during the process. Due to excessive text in cosmetic ingredient images, I trained the model by cutting it to 30 characters or less. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, there were difficulties in extracting the desired level of complete text from the Backend. answer:
When deciding on the technology stack to include in your portfolio, you mainly consider the following:

1. Core Technologies: Your portfolio will mainly include technologies that you use frequently or are proficient in. For example, core technologies like Python as the main language and AI/ML frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch would be included in your core technology stack.

2. Supporting Technologies: Technologies that can complement or extend your core technologies are also taken into account. For instance, Flask and Node.js support web development, Git is used for collaboration and version control, and AWS and Docker can be included for deployment and operations.

3. Project-Specific Technologies: Technologies or experiences used in specific projects can also be included in your portfolio. For example, experience in developing OCR models and fine-tuning with GPT Assistant can be considered relevant to the respective project.

By considering these factors comprehensively, you determine the technology stack to include in your portfolio.

When structuring a portfolio, especially in the context of a tech-related field like AI and software development, there are a few key points to pay attention to:

1. **Relevance**: Ensure that the projects and experiences included in the portfolio are directly relevant to the type of roles you are targeting. Highlighting projects that showcase your skills, expertise, and accomplishments in the specific areas of interest to potential employers is essential.

2. **Detail and Impact**: Provide detailed information about each project, including the technologies used, your role and responsibilities, project duration, and the outcomes or impact of the project. Quantifying the impact where possible can help demonstrate the value you bring.

3. **Consistency and Professionalism**: Maintain a consistent format and style throughout the portfolio to present a cohesive narrative of your skills and experiences. Pay attention to visual presentation, grammar, and overall professionalism to make a positive impression.

4. **Diversity**: Include a variety of projects that demonstrate your versatility and range of skills. This could include individual projects, team collaborations, personal projects, and any unique initiatives that showcase your capabilities.

5. **Continuous Learning and Growth**: Showcase any ongoing learning initiatives, certifications, or personal projects that reflect your commitment to professional development and staying abreast of industry trends.

By focusing on these aspects, you can create a strong portfolio that effectively communicates your capabilities and experiences to potential employers or collaborators.

answer:
To create a successful portfolio as an AI engineer, here are some general recommendations based on common practices:

1. **Diverse Projects**: Include a variety of AI and machine learning projects in your portfolio to showcase your skills and expertise in different areas such as computer vision, natural language processing, or reinforcement learning.

2. **Demonstrate Depth of Knowledge**: Show your understanding of AI concepts by including detailed explanations of your projects, the methodologies used, and the results achieved. Highlight any unique approaches or optimizations you implemented.

3. **Open Source Contributions**: Consider contributing to open-source AI projects to demonstrate your collaboration skills, coding abilities, and understanding of industry-standard practices.

4. **Showcase Your Tech Stack**: Clearly list your technical skills, tools, and programming languages you are proficient in, as well as any certifications or courses you have completed related to AI and machine learning.

5. **Interactive Demonstrations**: Whenever possible, provide interactive demos or links to live projects to allow potential employers or collaborators to interact with your work firsthand.

6. **Continuous Learning**: Highlight your commitment to continuous learning by mentioning any ongoing AI-related courses, workshops, or conferences you attend to stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in the field.

7. **Personal Touch**: Add a personal statement or summary about your passion for AI, your career goals, and what drives you to work in this field. This can help recruiters or hiring managers understand your motivations and aspirations.

By incorporating these elements into your portfolio, you can present yourself as a well-rounded AI engineer with a strong technical background and a genuine interest in the field.

answer: To create a portfolio that showcases your experience effectively as a developer, you can consider organizing it in the following manner: 1. **Introduction**: Start your portfolio with a brief introduction about yourself, your background, and your key skills. 2. **Projects Showcase**: - **Overview**: Provide a list of projects you have worked on, along with a brief description of each project. - **Details**: Include detailed information about each project, such as the problem statement, your role, technologies used, challenges faced, and your solutions. - **Code Samples**: Optionally, include links to GitHub repositories or code snippets to demonstrate your coding skills. - **Results**: Highlight the outcomes or impact of each project, showcasing your problem-solving abilities. 3. **Technical Skills**: - List your programming languages, frameworks, libraries, and tools you are proficient in. This can be structured under categories like Programming Languages, AI/ML, Web Development, and Other Technologies. - Mention any certifications, courses, or specializations related to these skills. 4. **Work Experience**: - If applicable, include a section detailing your work experience as a developer. Mention the roles you have held, companies you have worked for, and key projects you contributed to. - Highlight any achievements, promotions, or responsibilities that demonstrate your growth as a developer. 5. **Education**: - Provide information about your educational background, including degrees, courses, and relevant academic projects. 6. **Testimonials or Recommendations**: - If available, include testimonials from previous colleagues, managers, or clients that speak to your skills, work ethic, and professionalism. 7. **Contact Information**: - Ensure your portfolio includes a section with your contact details, such as email address, phone number, and LinkedIn profile, making it easy for potential employers to reach out to you. By structuring your portfolio in this way, you can effectively showcase your experience, skills, and achievements as a developer, making it easier for potential employers to understand your capabilities and consider you for opportunities in the industry.

question: What was the most challenging experience while composing your portfolio?
context: Experience of project assignments * Experiences of performing projects alone or in team composition in reverse chronological order OCR technology-based cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Manpower composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself) Project purpose Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Korean-based OCR model development Development of score calculation algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Language and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Departmental GPU server use (Linux) Impression I realized the importance of data while developing an AI model. Naver Clovaai, which was used as a reference material, is an English-based model, so I trained it using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub. --- Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An 5 --- I proceeded. There was an excessive amount of text in cosmetics ingredient photos, so I trained it by cutting it to less than 30 characters. However, due to the limitations of data and computing resources, there was difficulty in extracting the desired level of complete text in the Backend. To overcome this, I introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by Fine-tuning the cosmetics ingredients on GPT Assistant. Reference material https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/tree/master Developer hiring platform
answer: The most challenging experience while composing my portfolio was extracting complete text from cosmetics ingredient photos. Due to limitations in data and computing resources, there was difficulty in extracting the desired level of text. To overcome this, I introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by Fine-tuning the cosmetics ingredients on GPT Assistant.

answer: When it comes to designing a portfolio, there are several key design elements to keep in mind to make it visually appealing and effective: 1. **Consistency**: Ensure consistency in fonts, colors, and overall style throughout the portfolio to create a cohesive look. 2. **Whitespace**: Use adequate whitespace to make the content easy to read and navigate. Avoid cluttered layouts. 3. **Visual Hierarchy**: Organize content in a way that guides the reader's eye smoothly through the portfolio, highlighting key information effectively. 4. **Graphics and Images**: Incorporate relevant graphics and images to enhance the visual appeal and showcase your work effectively. However, make sure they are high quality and relevant to the content. 5. **Typography**: Choose appropriate fonts for headings, subheadings, and body text that are easy to read and align with the overall aesthetic of the portfolio. 6. **Navigation**: Make sure the portfolio is easy to navigate, with clear sections and possibly a table of contents if it's a longer document. 7. **Branding**: If you have a personal brand, ensure that your portfolio reflects this in terms of colors, logos, and overall style. By paying attention to these design elements, you can create a professional and visually appealing portfolio that effectively showcases your skills and accomplishments.

question: When receiving a portfolio review, what points should be paid attention to?
context:
Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file)
https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt
Hi I'm ChangHoon An
5
---
Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file)
LoRA-based Fine-Tuning on Prompt-driven Translation Tasks (koâ†’en, enâ†’ko)
Vector DB Extract Context Translation Model(ko-en) QA Model(English) Translation Model(en-ko) Output Model Structure
Translation Model: facebook/mbart-large-50-one-to-many-mmt
QA Model: google/flan-t5-large
https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot
Portfolio ChatBot Using GPT API(~ing)
Use RAG, GPT API, AWS(~ing)
Hi I'm ChangHoon An
4
---
Project Experience * List project experiences performed alone or in a team in reverse chronological order
Development of AI cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and recommendation service using OCR technology
Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20
Staffing Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1(self)
Project Objective Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users
Main Tasks and Detailed Roles
Development of Korean-based OCR model
Development of scoring algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients
Cosmetics recommendation using cosine similarity
Languages and Development Environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server used (Linux)
Reflections
I realized the importance of data while developing AI models. I used the Naver Clovaai as a reference, which is an English-based model, and trained it using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub.
answer:
When reviewing a portfolio, it is important to pay attention to the following points:
1. Detailed description of project experiences: Clearly describe the nature of the projects, work periods, staffing, main objectives, and roles.
2. Technical skills and tools/languages used: Specify the technologies, tools, languages, and development environments used in each project.
3. Achievements and outcomes: Clearly express the model's structure, outcomes, performance evaluations, value provided to users, etc.
4. Sharing lessons learned and experiences: Honestly share experiences gained, challenges faced, areas for improvement, etc., to demonstrate growth potential.
Emphasizing and explaining these elements effectively will help the portfolio be evaluated more effectively by others.

question: To emphasize your career as an AI developer, what project did you include in your portfolio?
context: Experience in project assignments * Experience in performing projects alone or in team composition, listed in reverse chronological order
answer: I included the project on developing a cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service in my portfolio. In this project, I utilized OCR technology to extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommended cosmetics to users based on that. Key tasks included developing a Korean-based OCR model, developing an algorithm to calculate scores based on ingredients, and recommending cosmetics using cosine similarity. This project was developed using Python, Tensorflow, and Pytorch.

question: What was the most difficult part when creating your portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An ...
answer: The most difficult part was extracting the desired level of complete text from the Backend due to limitations in data and computing resources. Handling excessive text in cosmetic ingredient photos was challenging, and to overcome this, a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model through Fine-tuning with GPT Assistant was introduced.

question: Please tell me which AI project is included in your portfolio.
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) at https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An
answer: The AI project included in my portfolio is the development of a service for analyzing, comparing, and recommending cosmetics using OCR technology. question: What kind of project should be included in a portfolio to showcase the capabilities of an AI engineer?
context: Experience in project assignments * List experiences of performing projects alone or in team in reverse chronological order OCR technology-based cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Personnel Composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1(myself) Project Objective Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Korean-based OCR model development Development of Score calculation algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Languages and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server use (Linux) Insights Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. Used Naver Clovaai as a reference, which is an English-based model, and trained using AI Hub's Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset.
answer: To showcase the capabilities of an AI engineer, it is recommended to include the project of developing an OCR technology-based cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service in the portfolio. In this project, I performed roles such as developing a Korean-based OCR model, developing a Score calculation algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients, and utilizing Cosine similarity for cosmetics recommendation. Through this project, I can demonstrate my abilities in AI model development, algorithm development, and the use of programming languages such as Python, Tensorflow, and Pytorch.

Project Objective Extracting text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommending cosmetics to users
Main Tasks and Detailed Roles
Developing a Korean-based OCR model

Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity

question: Please talk about your experience with projects utilizing AI technology.
context: List your project experiences in reverse chronological order, whether conducted individually or as part of a team.
answer: As an AI Engineer, I worked on a project developing a cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service using OCR technology. The project aimed to extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users. My main tasks included developing a Korean-based OCR model, creating a score calculation algorithm based on ingredients, and providing cosmetics recommendations using Cosine similarity. I realized the importance of data while developing AI models. I trained the model using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub, as the reference Naver Clovaai was English-based. I utilized Python, Tensorflow, and Pytorch in a GPU server environment for this project.

question: Is there a specific aspect that you consider most important when creating a portfolio?

answer: When creating a portfolio, it is crucial to showcase your most relevant and impactful projects or experiences. Highlighting your technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and the results or outcomes of your projects can greatly enhance your portfolio. Additionally, emphasizing any unique or innovative approaches you took in your projects can make your portfolio stand out. It's also important to ensure that your portfolio is well-organized, visually appealing, and easy to navigate for the reader. By emphasizing these key aspects, you can effectively communicate your capabilities and expertise to potential employers or collaborators.

context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An 5 --- Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) LoRA-based Fine-Tuning on Prompt-driven Translation Tasks (koâ†’en, enâ†’ko) Vector DB Extract Context Translation Model(ko-en) QA Model(English) Translation Model(en-ko) Output Model Structure Translation Model : facebook/mbart-large-50-one-to-many-mmt QA Model : google/flan-t5-large https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot Portfolio ChatBot Using GPT API(~ing) Use RAG, GPT API (âœ…) , AWS(~ing) Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An 4 --- Project Experience * List experiences of projects performed alone or in a team in reverse chronological order Using OCR technology for cosmetic ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetic recommendation service development Project Period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Personnel Composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1(myself) Project Purpose Extract text from photos of cosmetic ingredients and recommend cosmetics to users Main Tasks and Detailed Roles Development of Korean-based OCR model Development of algorithm to calculate scores based on ingredients for cosmetics Cosmetics recommendation using cosine similarity Languages and Development Environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server used (Linux) Insights Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. answer: One of the projects you may want to include in your portfolio is the development of the AI cosmetic ingredient analysis, comparison, and recommendation service using OCR technology. This project involved tasks such as developing a Korean-based OCR model, creating an algorithm to calculate scores based on cosmetic ingredients, and recommending cosmetics using cosine similarity. It is a substantial project that showcases your skills in AI development and working with different technologies like Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch on a GPU server. Additionally, the experience gained from this project, especially regarding the importance of data in developing AI models, could be valuable to highlight in your portfolio.

answer: When creating a portfolio, there are several common elements to be mindful of. question: What was the most difficult part of creating your portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An...
answer: Based on the provided project experience in the portfolio, it seems that one of the most challenging aspects of creating the portfolio was dealing with the limitations of data and computing resources when extracting complete text from cosmetic ingredient photos. This challenge led to difficulties in achieving the desired level of text extraction in the backend. To overcome this issue, the approach of fine-tuning GPT Assistant with cosmetic ingredients was adopted to refine the text extracted by the OCR model. Therefore, dealing with the constraints of data and computing resources for text extraction could be considered as one of the most challenging parts of creating the portfolio in this case.

question: What is the most important factor to consider when writing a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer: When writing a portfolio, one of the most important factors to consider is showcasing your relevant experiences and projects that demonstrate your skills and expertise. This includes detailing the projects you have worked on, the technologies you have used, your role and responsibilities, the outcomes or results achieved, and any significant learnings or insights gained from each project. By highlighting concrete examples of your work and accomplishments, you provide solid evidence of your capabilities to potential employers or collaborators.

question: What are some key points to pay attention to when creating a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer:
When creating a portfolio, it is important to pay attention to several key points to make it effective and impactful. Here are some common considerations:

1. **Highlight Relevant Projects**: Showcase projects and experiences that are most relevant to the position or industry you are targeting. Tailor your portfolio to demonstrate your skills and expertise in those areas.

2. **Clear and Concise Presentation**: Keep your portfolio organized and easy to navigate. Use clear headings, bullet points, and visuals to present information in a structured manner.

3. **Demonstrate Skills and Achievements**: Clearly articulate your skills, accomplishments, and the impact of your work in each project or experience. Use quantifiable results or metrics where possible to showcase your contributions.

4. **Visual Appeal**: Create a visually appealing portfolio with a clean design, consistent branding, and high-quality images or graphics. Aesthetically pleasing portfolios can leave a positive impression on recruiters or potential clients.

5. **Update Regularly**: Keep your portfolio up to date with your latest projects, skills, and achievements. Regularly review and refresh your portfolio to ensure that it reflects your current abilities and accomplishments.

By paying attention to these key points, you can create a compelling portfolio that effectively showcases your skills and experiences to potential employers or clients.

answer: Extracting text from cosmetics ingredient photos was the most difficult part. Due to limitations in data and computing resources, there were difficulties in extracting the desired level of complete text. To overcome this, I fine-tuned cosmetics ingredients with GPT Assistant to refine the text extracted by the OCR model.

question: What was the most impressive project you worked on?
context: Experience of project assignments * List experiences of performing projects alone or in team in reverse chronological order OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Manpower composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1(myself) Project objective Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Developing Korean-based OCR model Developing algorithm to calculate cosmetics score based on ingredients Recommending cosmetics using Cosine similarity Languages and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Using department GPU server (Linux) Impressions Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. Used Naver Clovaai as reference material, which is an English-based model, and trained using AI Hub's Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset.
answer: The most impressive project appears to be the development of an AI cosmetics recommendation service using OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis and comparison. The experience of implementing a service that analyzes and recommends cosmetics based on AI models is considered very meaningful. In particular, roles such as developing a Korean-based OCR model, creating a score calculation algorithm for cosmetics, and utilizing Cosine similarity for cosmetics recommendations are expected to have been performed. It is presumed that through this project, a deep understanding of the importance of data and practical experience in AI model development were gained.

question: How can I effectively showcase my career in my portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer:
To effectively showcase your experience in your portfolio, you can consider the following strategies:

1. **Clear Project Descriptions**: Provide detailed descriptions of the projects you have worked on, mentioning your specific contributions, technologies used, and outcomes achieved. This will give potential employers a clear understanding of your skills and experience.

2. **Impactful Accomplishments**: Highlight key achievements and results from your projects. Quantifying your accomplishments with specific metrics or outcomes can help demonstrate the value you bring to the table.

3. **Skills and Technologies**: Clearly list the technologies, programming languages, frameworks, and tools you are proficient in. This will give recruiters a quick overview of your technical expertise.

4. **Certifications and Training**: Include any relevant certifications, courses, or training programs you have completed. This shows your commitment to continuous learning and professional development.

5. **Testimonials or Recommendations**: If possible, include testimonials or recommendations from colleagues or clients to validate your skills and work ethic.

6. **Visual Portfolio**: Consider including visuals such as charts, graphs, or screenshots of your work to make your portfolio visually appealing and engaging.

7. **Personal Branding**: Ensure that your portfolio reflects your personal brand and conveys your unique strengths and skills effectively.

By following these tips and presenting your experience in a clear, concise, and compelling manner, you can effectively showcase your career progression and expertise in your portfolio.

question: Please tell me what to be careful about when creating a portfolio.
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An
answer:

1. **Maintain Professionalism**: Include projects, research, technical skills relevant to the field in the portfolio.

4. **Keep it Updated**: Reflect the latest information and update the portfolio regularly to maintain credibility.
5. **Purpose of the Portfolio**: The portfolio should be structured according to its purpose, and if it is for job-seeking, it should be tailored to meet the employer's requirements.

answer:
When creating a portfolio, there are several key points to keep in mind:

1. **Relevance**: Ensure that the projects and experiences included in your portfolio are relevant to the type of positions you are applying for. Tailoring your portfolio to showcase skills that are in line with the job requirements can make a strong impression on potential employers.

2. **Presentation**: Pay attention to the overall layout, design, and organization of your portfolio. Make sure it is visually appealing, easy to navigate, and effectively highlights your key achievements and skills.

3. **Detailed Descriptions**: Provide clear and concise descriptions of each project or experience included in your portfolio. Explain your role, the technologies used, challenges faced, and the outcomes achieved. Include relevant links to code repositories or live demos where applicable.

4. **Diversity**: Showcase a diverse range of projects and experiences to demonstrate your versatility and adaptability. Including projects that cover a variety of technologies or problem domains can help showcase your skills and expertise in different areas.

5. **Consistency**: Maintain consistency in the formatting, language, and tone used throughout your portfolio. This helps create a cohesive and professional impression.

6. **Regular Updates**: Keep your portfolio up to date with your latest projects, experiences, and achievements. Regularly review and refresh your portfolio to ensure it accurately represents your current skills and capabilities.

By paying attention to these key points, you can create a compelling portfolio that effectively showcases your skills and experiences to potential employers.

answer:
When creating a portfolio, it should typically include the following key elements:

1. **Personal Information:** Include your name, contact information, and a professional summary or introduction.

2. **Projects and Experiences:** Detail your projects, both personal and team-based, including project titles, descriptions, duration, your role, technologies used, and outcomes or achievements.

3. **Skills and Technologies:** List your skills in programming languages, tools, frameworks, and technologies related to your projects.

4. **Education:** Mention your academic background, degrees, certifications, and relevant coursework.

5. **Work Experience:** Include any relevant work experience, internships, or industry roles you have held.

6. **Publications or Presentations:** If applicable, add any research publications, conference presentations, or articles you have authored.

7. **Testimonials or Recommendations:** If available, include testimonials or recommendations from colleagues, supervisors, or clients.

8. **Links to Projects:** Provide links to your GitHub repositories, personal websites, or any live projects or demos.

By including these elements, your portfolio will provide a comprehensive overview of your skills, experiences, and accomplishments to potential employers or collaborators.

answer:
When creating a portfolio, it is recommended to include the following content:

1. Project List: Provide detailed information about each project, including title, summary, technologies used, and links to the deliverables.
2. Technical Skills: List the programming languages, frameworks, libraries used to showcase your technical abilities.

Including the above content will help clearly communicate your capabilities and skills to others.

question: What framework did you use when creating your portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer: In the projects worked on by ChangHoon An in the portfolio, the 'LoRA-based Fine-Tuning on Prompt-driven Translation Tasks' project utilized the facebook/mbart-large-50-one-to-many-mmt and google/flan-t5-large models. Additionally, in the tech stack, frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, OpenAI API, Hugging Face Transformers for AI/ML, and Node.js, Flask for web development were used.

question: What was the most challenging aspect of the project utilizing AI technology?
context: Project experience * List the experiences of performing projects alone or in a team in reverse chronological order OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetics recommendation service development Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Manpower composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself) Project objective Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Development of Korean-based OCR model Development of algorithm for calculating cosmetics score based on ingredients Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Languages and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Departmental GPU server (Linux) Thoughts: I realized the importance of data while developing AI models. I used Naver Clovaai as a reference material, which is an English-based model, and trained it using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub.
answer: The most challenging aspect of the project utilizing AI technology was extracting complete text from cosmetics ingredient photos. Due to limitations in data and computing resources, we faced difficulties in extracting the desired level of complete text in the Backend. To overcome this, we introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by fine-tuning cosmetics ingredients on GPT Assistant.

question: What is the most important aspect to consider when creating a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An ...
answer: When creating a portfolio, one of the most important aspects to consider is showcasing your relevant projects and experiences. This allows potential employers or collaborators to understand your skills, expertise, and accomplishments. It is essential to highlight the projects you have worked on, the technologies you have used, your roles and responsibilities, the outcomes achieved, and any significant contributions you have made. Additionally, including any positive feedback or results from your projects can further strengthen your portfolio. Providing clear and detailed information about your work helps demonstrate your capabilities and suitability for specific opportunities in your field.

question: What are the points to be careful of when writing a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer: The points to be careful of when writing a portfolio are as follows: 1. The content of the portfolio should be clear and specific. The purpose of the projects, technologies used, and outcomes should be well presented. 2. Detailed descriptions of each project or experience should be provided, avoiding overly technical terms and ensuring that even non-specialists can understand. 3. Visually, the portfolio should be clean and professional in design. It should use appropriate layouts and colors. 4. Emphasizing the results and achievements of the projects in the portfolio is recommended. If the achievements can be quantified, even better. 5. Only include the most up-to-date information in the portfolio. It is important to have the habit of updating it to match your resume.

question: Please tell me about a good AI-related competition experience to include in my portfolio.
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) at https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An 5 --- Project Experience * List experiences of conducting projects alone or in a team in reverse chronological order Utilizing OCR technology for cosmetic ingredient analysis, comparison, and developing an AI cosmetics recommendation service Project Period: 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Team Composition: Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself) Project Objective: Extract text from photos of cosmetic ingredients and recommend cosmetics to users Main Tasks and Roles: - Development of a Korean-based OCR model - Development of an algorithm to calculate scores based on ingredients - Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity Language and Development Environment: Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Using department GPU server (Linux) Insights: Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. Used Naver Clovaai as a reference, but since it is an English-based model, trained it using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetic packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub. --- Cut text to 30 characters or less due to excessive text in cosmetic ingredient photos. Faced difficulties in extracting complete text at desired levels in the Backend due to data and computing resource limitations. To overcome this, fine-tuned cosmetic ingredients with GPT Assistant to refine the text extracted by the OCR model. Reference: https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/tree/master Developer hiring platform
answer: Based on the project experience detailed in the provided information, an excellent AI-related competition experience that could be included in your portfolio is participating in a competition focusing on OCR technology, natural language processing, or image recognition. Given your involvement in developing an OCR model for analyzing cosmetic ingredients and providing AI-based cosmetics recommendations, showcasing your participation in a competition related to these areas would be beneficial for your portfolio. This could demonstrate your practical skills, problem-solving abilities, and expertise in the field of AI.

question: What are some practical experiences that are good to include in a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An 5 --- Project experience * List the experiences of performing projects alone or in a team in reverse chronological order Using OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and developing AI cosmetic recommendation service Work period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20 Manpower composition Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself) Project objective Extracting text from photos of cosmetics ingredients and recommending cosmetics to users Main tasks and detailed roles Developing a Korean-based OCR model Developing an algorithm for calculating the score of cosmetics based on ingredients Recommending cosmetics using Cosine similarity Languages and development environment Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Department GPU server used (Linux) Insights Realized the importance of data while developing the AI model. Used the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub for training, as the reference material Naver Clovaai is an English-based model. --- Proceeded. There was an excessive amount of text in the photos of cosmetics ingredients, so we cut it to less than 30 characters for training. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, there was difficulty in extracting the desired level of complete text from the Backend. To overcome this, we introduced a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model by Fine-tuning the cosmetics ingredients on GPT Assistant. Reference material: https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/tree/master Developer hiring platform
answer: Including the experience of participating as an AI engineer in the project of using OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and developing AI cosmetic recommendation service is a good practical experience to include in a portfolio. In this project, tasks such as developing a Korean-based OCR model, developing an algorithm for calculating the score of cosmetics based on ingredients, and utilizing Cosine similarity for cosmetic recommendations were carried out. Particularly noteworthy is the experience of overcoming the limitations of data and computing resources by introducing a method of refining the text extracted by the OCR model through Fine-tuning cosmetics ingredients on GPT Assistant.

question: How can project achievements be effectively showcased when writing a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An...
answer: When writing a portfolio, you can effectively showcase project achievements by highlighting specific outcomes and impact of the project. Some ways to do this include: 1. **Quantifiable Results:** Include measurable results such as performance improvements, cost savings, efficiency gains, or user engagement metrics achieved as a result of the project. 2. **Problem-Solution Approach:** Clearly outline the problem or challenge addressed by the project, the solutions implemented, and how these solutions positively impacted the intended stakeholders or users. 3. **Technological Innovations:** Highlight any innovative technologies, algorithms, or methodologies used in the project that set it apart from others in the field. 4. **Collaboration and Teamwork:** If applicable, mention how the project was successfully executed through effective teamwork, collaboration, and individual contributions. 5. **Feedback/Testimonials:** Incorporate any positive feedback, testimonials, or reviews received from stakeholders, clients, or end-users regarding the project outcomes and impact. By incorporating these elements into your portfolio when describing your project experiences, you can effectively demonstrate the value and success of your work to potential employers or collaborators.

question: What factors should be considered when writing a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt Hi I'm ChangHoon An
answer:
When writing a portfolio, the following factors should be considered:
1. Project Experience: Clearly describe the work period, project objectives, main tasks, and detailed roles of each project.
2. Technology Stack and Development Environment: Specify the languages, frameworks, tools used, and provide information about the development environment.
3. Achievements and Results: Describe in detail the achievements made through the projects, problems solved, etc.
4. Personal Experiences and Insights: Express the experiences gained, insights, and lessons learned from the projects to convey personal growth and effort.
5. Portfolio Design: Consider the layout, colors, consistency, etc., of the portfolio to enhance readability and visual impact.

question: What was your most recent completed AI project?
context: List your project experiences in order of most recent, whether done alone or in a team. Utilized OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis, comparison, and development of AI cosmetics recommendation service. Project duration was from March 1, 2024, to June 20, 2024. Team composition: Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself). Project objective was to extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users. Key tasks included developing a Korean-based OCR model, developing a score calculation algorithm based on ingredients, and recommending cosmetics using cosine similarity. Used languages and development environment: Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch, utilized GPU server (Linux).
answer: My most recent completed AI project was the development of an AI cosmetics recommendation service using OCR technology for cosmetics ingredient analysis and comparison. The project took place from March 1, 2024, to June 20, 2024, and my role was as an AI Engineer. The project aimed to extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users. Key tasks included developing a Korean-based OCR model, developing a score calculation algorithm based on ingredients, and utilizing cosine similarity for cosmetics recommendations. The project utilized Python, Tensorflow, and Pytorch.

question: What is the most important aspect to consider when creating a portfolio?
context: Use my portfolio PDF and resume (TXT file) at https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot_gpt
answer: When creating a portfolio, one of the most important aspects to consider is showcasing your relevant projects and experiences prominently. This includes providing detailed information about the projects you have worked on, the technologies you have used, your specific roles and contributions, and the outcomes or results achieved. Additionally, highlighting any specific challenges you faced and how you overcame them can also be valuable in demonstrating your problem-solving skills and resilience. Overall, the goal is to present a comprehensive view of your skills, expertise, and accomplishments to make a strong impression on potential employers or collaborators.

answer: Based on the project experience described in the provided text, it seems that the most challenging part of the portfolio creation for ChangHoon An might have been dealing with the limitations in data and computing resources while working on the OCR technology for cosmetic ingredient analysis and AI cosmetic recommendation service development. The difficulty in extracting complete text at the desired level from cosmetic ingredient photos due to excessive text content and resource constraints would have been a significant challenge. To overcome this challenge, the approach of fine-tuning GPT Assistant with cosmetic ingredients and introducing a method to refine the text extracted by the OCR model was adopted. Therefore, discussing how ChangHoon An navigated and overcame these challenges related to data volume and computing resources in the project development could have been one of the most difficult parts to articulate in his portfolio.

Hi IÊ¼ m ChangHoon An
5
---
Project Experience * List experiences of projects done alone or in a team in reverse chronological order
Developed a service for analyzing, comparing, and recommending cosmetics using OCR technology
Work Period 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20
Team Composition: Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself)
Project Objective: Extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users
Main Tasks and Roles:
- Developed a Korean-based OCR model
- Developed an algorithm to calculate the score of cosmetics based on ingredients
- Cosmetics recommendation using Cosine similarity
Languages and Development Environment: Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Used department GPU server (Linux)
Reflection: Realized the importance of data while developing AI models. Used Naver Clovaai as a reference, trained with Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR datasets from AI Hub.
answer:
In a portfolio, you can include the following technical achievements:

1. Projects or tasks using main programming languages such as Python, SQL, C, C++, Java, JavaScript.
2. Experience with AI/ML projects using TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, OpenAI API, Hugging Face Transformers.
3. Experience with web development using Node.js, Flask.
4. Other technical skills using Git, Docker, AWS, Linux, RESTful API.
5. Details of the 'Developed a service for analyzing, comparing, and recommending cosmetics using OCR technology' project including main tasks and roles, languages and development environment used, and reflections during the project.

answer: The scale of AI projects can vary, but generally, a medium-sized project is preferred when adding to a portfolio. question: Please provide an example of an AI project suitable to add to a portfolio.
context:
Tech Stack:

Programming Languages:
- Python (main language)
- SQL
- C
- C++
- Java
- JavaScript

AI/ML:
- TensorFlow
- PyTorch
- LangChain
- OpenAI API
- Hugging Face Transformers

Web Development:
- Node.js
- Flask

Other Technologies:
- Git
- Docker
- AWS
- Linux
- RESTful API

Assignment Project Experience * List experiences of projects done alone or in a team in reverse chronological order
Developing a cosmetic ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetic recommendation service using OCR technology
Work period: 2024.03.01 ~ 2024.06.20
Team Composition: Frontend 1, Backend 2, AI Engineer 1 (myself)
Project Objective: Extract text from cosmetic ingredient photos and recommend cosmetics to users
Main Tasks and Detailed Roles
Developing a Korean-based OCR model
Developing a scoring algorithm for cosmetics based on ingredients
Cosmetic recommendation using Cosine similarity
Languages and Development Environment: Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch | Using department GPU server (Linux)
Reflection
I realized the importance of data while developing AI models. I trained the model using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetic packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub, as the reference material Naver Clovaai was an English-based model.
answer:
Based on the provided portfolio information, a suitable AI project example to add could be a project focused on developing a recommendation system for personalized online shopping. This project could involve analyzing customer preferences and behaviors to recommend products tailored to their individual needs and interests.

For this project, you could use AI/ML libraries like TensorFlow or PyTorch to build recommendation algorithms. Additionally, utilizing data from e-commerce platforms or customer interaction history would be essential for training the recommendation system effectively.

To enhance your portfolio further, you may consider highlighting your expertise in AI model development, data preprocessing, and algorithm implementation, demonstrating your ability to create practical solutions in the field of artificial intelligence.
